The bulk of the scientific literature — including dozens of epidemiologic studies, animal experiments, and mechanistic work — supports this conclusion.  A few isolated studies raise questions about possible non‑thermal biological effects, but they are either (a) methodologically weak, (b) conducted at exposure intensities far above real‑world levels, or (c) have not been replicated.
